text.p: These are the leading stories in the Kenyan press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Opposition FORD-Kenya party accuses other opposition politicians of smearing their chairman to derail his bid for the presidency.
- Rift Valley provincial commissioner says more than a million people face starvation.
- A Mombasa court is told police covered up during investigations into the disappearance of vehicles from the port.
- U.S. Ambassador Prudence Bushnell urges President Daniel arap Moi to take concrete steps to end rampant corruption.
- Two police officers are jailed for a total of 12 years for raping two women at gunpoint.
- Air traffic controllers threaten to go on strike from midnight.
- President Moi says it is a pity the victims of conflicts in Africa are women and children.
- A Belgian national is fined 10,000 shillings for harassing an air hostess aboard a Dutch airlines plane.
- A senior chief in Homa Bay district in western Kenya is picked up for questioning over allegations he killed a man. ($1=54 Kenyan shillings)
